availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Laten Bennett Porch (Louisville, Kentucky, clerk and dry goods merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, clerk and merchant. Virginia native. Son of Ezekiel A. Porch and Mary Bachelor Porch. Married to Hester C. Edward Porch in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on April 27, 1859. Father of Edwin Leight Porch and Nina R. Porch. Store clerk in Pulaski County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Pulaski County in 1850. Dry goods merchant in Louisville in 1860. Partner with Daniel B. Leight, Thomas L. Barrett, and Robert F. Cooke, in Leight, Barret, & Company dry goods merchants in Louisville in 1861. Partners with Daniel B. Leight and Robert F. Cooke in D. B. Leight & Company dry goods merchants in Louisville in 1865.
